item.title: Petersburg records thin win against Glennallen 45-38
item.dc:creator: Sports Desk
item.description: Petersburg records thin win against Glennallen 45-38
item.content:encoded:
Pins and needles were part of the price of admission as Petersburg nipped Glennallen 45-38 on Dec. 16 in Alaska girls high school basketball.

The Panthers authored a promising start, taking advantage of the Vikings 11-10 at the end of the first quarter.

Had this been a prize fight, the Panthers would’ve earned the judge’s decision at halftime, with a 17-14 lead on the Vikings.

The Vikings broke in front at the beginning of the fourth quarter with a 27-26 lead over the Panthers.

The clock was the only thing that stopped Petersburg, which enjoyed the upper hand in an 18-12 fourth quarter, too.

item.title: Bellaire outclasses Shadyside 53-42
item.dc:creator: Sports Desk
item.description: Bellaire outclasses Shadyside 53-42
item.content:encoded:
Bellaire grabbed a 53-42 victory at the expense of Shadyside in Ohio girls basketball on Dec. 23.

Shadyside showed it was ready to play, using an early thrust to carve out a 11-9 advantage over Bellaire as the first quarter ended.

Bellaire opened a meager 25-20 gap over Shadyside at halftime.

Bellaire and Shadyside were engaged in a narrow affair at 45-34 as the fourth quarter started.

It was tough sledding with defenses hanging tough for each side in a 53-42 final-quarter tie.

In recent action on Dec. 11, Shadyside faced off against Rayland Buckeye Local and Bellaire took on Belmont Union Local on Dec. 9 at Bellaire High School. Click here for a recap

item.dc:creator: Sports Desk
item.description: Rayland Buckeye Local squeezes past Barnesville 44-38
item.content:encoded:
Mighty close, mighty fine, Rayland Buckeye Local wore a victory shine after clipping Barnesville 44-38 at Barnesville High on Dec. 22 in Ohio girls high school basketball action.

Recently on Dec. 13 , Rayland Buckeye Local squared up on Martins Ferry in a basketball game . For a full recap, click here.

Rayland Buckeye Local moved in front of Barnesville 8-7 to begin the second quarter.

Barnesville took an 18-17 lead over Rayland Buckeye Local heading to the intermission locker room.

Barnesville darted a thin margin over Rayland Buckeye Local as both teams headed to make end of the third quarter adjustments.

The Panthers put a bow on this victory with a strong fourth-quarter kick, outpointing the Shamrocks 14-6 in the last stanza.
